website_summaries.verdict: A powerful and capable GPS computer.
pros: If you need a versatile computer with a display that can be customized for your needs, the Edge 520 is a great choice
Offers many connected features, such as automatic uploads, smart notifications, and real-time tracking
Includes cadence measurement and is compatible with heart rate monitors
Can track your progress and plan future workouts
cons: The GPS may lose location from time to time, and programming the device can be difficult

website_summaries.verdict: Accurate, full of features and supporting a ton of accessories, the Garmin Edge 520 is a great GPS bike computer for competitive riders.
pros: Accurately measures speed, distance, route and altitude of your rides with GPS
cons: Screen can be difficult to see in direct sunlight
The interface is confusing to navigate

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable companion
customer_reviews.text: I regularly ride alone and this small computer is always my reliable companion. With my mobile phone's bluetooth, I'm able to effortlessly synch my ride to garmin connect and auto upload it to my Strava account. Prior to having my edge 520, I was using my forerunner 305 and 910xt to record my rides. Of course the edge is far better because I'm able to easily check my data on a bigger screen. With the auto scroll setup I'm able to see more data and my route.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The interface is easy to navigate and the device connects seamlessly with the phone app via Bluetooth. I've never had a problem with satellite reception either. It keeps track of every single bit of information about my ride that I could possibly want, which I can track easily through Garmin Connect and Strava. Add the speed sensor onto the wheel to get turbo-accurate information about your ride. I wouldn't say no to a longer-lasting battery, though. Seems a bit short and might be problematic for a ride day that lasts more than 4 hours.

customer_reviews.text: When the 520 came out the version 1 software had issues and there were a lot of negative reviews. The current version has cleared up most of the problems people were having, the way the STRAVA segments work is easy to figure out and it works great! Getting that little alert and map on the screen is s great training motivator when you get close to a segment you have starred

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in Jan 2018 and on 5/7/18 it has stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Jan 2018 and on 5/7/18 it has stopped working. Will not turn on, will not respond when plugged in to charge, nothing. It’s a brick. Now I have to wait for Garmin to decide if they are going to repair or replace with a refurbished unit??? Garmin quality has gone downhill since I had my 800. I wish I’d never “upgraded” to a new model.

customer_reviews.text: Very accurate speed and time. Just scratching the surface of capabilities but great data and downloads on my laptop. Acquires satellites quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Great device so far! Bluetooth sync working great with iphone 6!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Cleaner than the 500 and the 1000 was too big for me. I also like the buttons vs the touchscreen of the 1000. Bluetooth sync works great with my iphone 6, whereas I had issues syncing both my 500, 510 and 1000 over bluetooth. The one thing I miss from the 1000 is the wifi connectivity, it was very handy to finish your ride at home and have it auto upload over wifi... otherwise, great device! I have not tried the strava segments feature yet, so I can't speak to that.

Connected features4 include live tracking, smart notifications and automatic uploads to Garmin Connect.
